meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outyelling her brother during their argument.
meanings.sent2: The crowd started outyelling each other at the sports event.
meanings.sent3: The two friends playfully outyelled each other to see who could be the loudest.
meanings.sent4: Her voice outyelled the noise of the bustling city streets.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm seemed to outyell all other sounds with its booming presence.

meanings.definition: The act of shouting louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: His outyelling of the news caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The outyelling in the classroom made it hard to focus on the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The outyelling contest at the party was both amusing and chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The outyelling of the sirens drowned out all other noises.
meanings.sent5: The outyelling of the protesters echoed through the streets, demanding to be heard.
